Dear Ms. Schultz:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MiSEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (616)552-3662.

ALLEGATION:
Agency staff member has not provided facility with required 1643 for psychotropic
medication since the youth’s admission even after multiple requests were made.
There are concerns regarding the youth’s medications that need to be addressed
and at this time, there is no informed consent to adjust or dispense medication.
INVESTIGATION:
On 12/14/2020 I reviewed Youth A’s case file in MiSACWIS which showed that he
entered foster care on 10/22/2020 and was prescribed three psychotropic
medications on 11/2/2020. Youth A was placed in a residential facility on
11/30/2020. There was no informed consent located in the file and the only social
work contacts located in which informed consent was discussed was a contact
between Foster Care Worker 1 and her supervisor on 12/14/2020, the same day this
complaint was received, during which they discussed requesting court approval for
the medications.
On 12/22/2020 I spoke with Foster Care Worker 1 by phone. She reported that she
made an attempt to get the youth’s father to sign the informed consent at some
point, but he signed it on the wrong line. She stated that she reached out to him
“multiple times” to get his consent and that he consented over text, but he did not
sign the form. She reported that she also reached out to the prescribing physician
but has not gotten any response. She stated that, when Youth A was brought to a
residential facility on 11/30/2020, she did not provide them with informed consent. I
asked her if she asked the father to sign the form during any of her face to face
contacts with him and she stated that she did not have the form with her to do so.
She reported that the father was in quarantine related to Covid-19 from the middle of
November until the end of November, so she did not have physical contact with him
during that time. She stated that she did pursue a court order for the medication the
previous week. When I told her I could not find any of her attempts to obtain written
consent in the file, she stated that she entered all of these contacts in the file late
last week, after finding out about the investigation.
3

APPLICABLE RULE
FOM 802-1 PSYCHOTROPIC MEDICATION IN FOSTER CARE
Consent is required for the prescription and use of all
psychotropic medications for all children in foster care and
for children placed for adoption where the court has not
issued an order finalizing the adoption.
Documentation
The DHS-1643, Psychotropic Medication Informed Consent,
or the prescribing clinician's alternative consent form that
contains all the required elements of the DHS-1643 as
determined by the FC-PMOU, must be used to document
this discussion between the prescribing clinician and the
consenting party.
ANALYSIS: Foster Care Worker 1 admitted Youth A to a residential program
without providing or having obtained informed consent for his
prescribed psychotropic medication.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend no change to the license of this private child caring institution, upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan.
